Senior Guard Seminars

Every year, approximately 1 in 10 seniors will become a victim of financial abuse. Financial abuse of elders can be stopped if we all stand together. We teach seniors to take action when they recognize a warning sign of financial abuse. Seminars are taught in the local communities in partnership with locally-based, nonprofit agencies such as senior centers.

The seminars cover the major areas of fraud:

  • Sweepstakes scams
  • “Free” living trust informational luncheons
  • Co-signer traps
  • Predatory loans
  • Identity theft
  • Fraudulent contractors
  • Unsuitable floating rate and deferred rate annuities

For detailed information about this seminar, click here (PDF)

If you are a non-profit agency with clientele that could benefit from this seminar, please contact us. If you can arrange for the participants to attend the seminar, we can arrange for the instructor, materials and every other assistance possible. There is no cost to you. The number of people who could benefit from basic budgeting education is large and growing. Every day, people and families are re-entering the work force or in the process of being trained to enter the work force. Personal budgeting is a skill they will need to be successful.

Call us. Together, we can make a difference for individuals in your community who need help.
